abstract:
<jats:p>This study provides an integrative taxonomy-based review for the genus <jats:italic>Spilomicrus</jats:italic> Westwood in Germany using DNA barcoding and classic morphology.</jats:p>
          <jats:p><jats:italic>Spilomicrus simplex</jats:italic> Tomsik, 1947 is placed in synonymy with <jats:italic>S. antennatus</jats:italic> Jurine, 1807; <jats:italic>Spilomicrus thomsoni</jats:italic> Kieffer, 1911 is removed from synonymy with <jats:italic>S. hemipterus</jats:italic> Marshall, 1868. A lectotype is designated for <jats:italic>Spilomicrus nigripes</jats:italic> Thomson, 1858. Newly recorded for Germany are the following species: <jats:italic>S. thomsoni</jats:italic> Kieffer, 1911, <jats:italic>S. crassiclavis</jats:italic> Marshall, 1868, <jats:italic>S. lusitanicus</jats:italic> Kieffer, 1910 and <jats:italic>S. diversus</jats:italic> Chemyreva, 2021. Three species, <jats:italic>Spilomicrus brevimalaris</jats:italic> <jats:bold>sp. nov</jats:bold>., <jats:italic>S. flavecorpus</jats:italic> <jats:bold>sp. nov</jats:bold>. and <jats:italic>S. politus</jats:italic> <jats:bold>sp. nov</jats:bold>. are described as new to science. The 23 DNA-barcodes with species identification present a substantial addition over the previous German checklist. This study aims to update the number of nationwide known <jats:italic>Spilomicrus</jats:italic> species from fifteen to twenty. Furthermore, a new key to identify all European <jats:italic>Spilomicrus</jats:italic> species is provided.</jats:p>
title: Review of German Spilomicrus Westwood (Hymenoptera, Diapriidae, Spilomicrini)
